name: cavalierly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that does not consider other people's feelings or safety : He has been called arrogant and cavalierly confrontational by his critics. I have to say I'm disappointed that they take their obligations so cavalierly.
More examplesFewer examplesMany people cavalierly think they can manage powerful dogs.It surprises me that the governor's office could so cavalierly disregard the state's laws.Postnatal depression often goes unrecognized by women who are struggling with it and cavalierly ignored by society.
